content.description: Mantle onto the weird hip height feature, collect your wits and throw for the slopey lip.
content.location: This route can be found on the Tower Parkway side of Ezra Stiles College by the garage and trash pickup area.

content.description: Stand start on top of ID swiper. Set a fist jam in the roof and lean back to grab the horn. Campus up the formation and top out onto the balcony. Easy walk off.
content.location: Main entrance of Morse College Dining Hall.

content.description: Begin standing in the small dihedral, left hand pinching the vertical ribs on the corner, right crimping the small flat top of a rib where a seam runs horizontally above you. Stem and then navigate the ribs left around the corner and shuffle onto the nearby platform. Project: begin in the small alcove behind the glowing blue security pole and traverse around the corner and across the face into the dihedral and finish like above.
content.protection: None or a pad but that might be conspicuous
content.location: Chapel street, an alcove behind the school of architecture.

content.description: The best of Yale buildering lore, the Durfee Traverse is a classic amongst new and experience climbers alike begins in the same way as the V3 variant. After rounding the corner where the V3 ends, the crimps get progressively smaller and the feet come fewer and farther between. After a long fight with the pump a few hard moves await near the end before ending with both hands on the pillar near the gate.
content.protection: A spotter or a pad is plenty
content.location: Same as Durfee Traverse, just to the left of Durfee A entryway on Old Campus.

content.description: Start on chalked opposing crimps directly to the left of Entryway A of Durfee Hall. Traverse left to the arete avoiding use of the heating grate ledge for feet or the sloping ledge for hands above the climbable stone. Gain a good stance on the arete (V3 to here).Edit 11/6/2020: The traverse all the way to the gate was an open project until recently. It goes at about V7; see here.
content.location: Yale University Old Campus Durfee Hall, left of A Entryway

content.description:
For when you're bored in lab, and you realize that there's not only something to traverse, but you also have too much finger skin.

 On the side of the Provost building facing St. Mary's Church, start on chalked holds near the left window, and work your way right on sharp rock and smallish feet to a match on the metal gutter. In the same spirit as the Durfee Traverse, do not use the artificial-looking stone ledge for feet.
content.location: Left wall of Provost's House while facing it on Hillhouse Ave. Faces St Mary's church. Standard discretion required when buildering in a busy area applies.Â

content.description: For urban adventurers, buildering aficionados, or students with too little time to even make it to West Rock, Yale University's campus provides a surprising amount of decent stone.
